content.rendered:
You never get a second chance to make a first impression. That old adage is very true, especially for small law firm website design. For small law firms and solo attorneys, your website is often where people first judge you on your skill as a lawyer. And as unfair as it may be, consumers sometimes equate poor-quality websites with poor legal services. That’s a situation you want to avoid.

So what exactly is a small law firm? We think of it as any law firm with ten or fewer attorneys. Of course, solo attorneys are also in this group. In fact, we build some of the best solo attorney websites in the U.S. Working with small law firms and solo attorneys is our bread and butter and something we enjoy very much.

What sections and pages should small law firms include on their website?

We get this question a lot. Luckily, we have the answers with almost twenty years of experience building websites for lawyers. When walking clients through the lawyer website design process, we often refer to the following as the “core” set of sections and pages that each solo attorney or small law firm website should have:

  • Home Page. Think of the home page as your website’s hub. Everything a client may want should be accessible from this page within a click or two. The type of information you include on your home page and how much will depend on your project’s specifics.
  • Practice Area Pages. It would be best if you had a section on the website that discusses the legal services you provide. We typically recommend creating individual pages for each practice area rather than having one web page to discuss every matter your law firm handles. We do this for two reasons. First, it will be easier for your website visitors to find the legal services they need if you provide them in easy-to-find subcategories. Secondly, and sometimes, more importantly, creating individual pages for specific practice areas is a good lawyer SEO practice. It increases the likelihood that people can find your law firm via a web search for that particular topic.
  • Attorney Bios Pages. Your website should have a section for attorney bios. No matter how many attorneys are in your law firm, each attorney should have a dedicated bio page. Again, it will make it easier for visitors and search engines to find individual attorneys. Also, be sure your attorney bio pages include a photo of the attorney. Having an attorney photo increases the trust factor with potential clients. This is especially true for solo attorney websites.
  • Contact Page. Even if your law firm’s contact information is on every page of the website, we advise our clients always to have a separate Contact page and include it in the main navigation. Website visitors will still want to click on a Contact page for information, maps, email addresses, etc. The Contact page allows you to connect with your target audience. Please take advantage of it.

The sections and pages above should be the minimum you consider for your small law firm website design project. Other sections and pages that you should consider for your website include:

  • A Blog.
  • Testimonials/Google Reviews.
  • Representative Clients
  • Results.

Small law firm web design specialists

At Dan Gilroy Design, we understand how consumers think and interact with websites. For nearly twenty years, we’ve been designing some of the country’s best small law firm websites. We create small law firm websites that make that critical great first impression. Our small law firm web design and solo attorney websites are visually appealing, but they’re also fast and secure. Each website project we complete includes the following:

  • Custom Website Design. All of our small law firm web designs are custom made so that we can showcase your law firm and your legal services with surgical precision. We never use cookie-cutter themes or website templates. We produce signature websites explicitly tailored toward your small law firm’s needs.
  • Fast & Secure. We’re not just about putting on a pretty face. We design our solo and small law office websites to look good and be fast and secure. Before launch, each website goes through a rigorous testing phase to ensure that core web vitals, page load speed, and overall site performance are optimal.
  • Search Engine Optimization.  We design our websites with search engines in mind. We’ve been doing this for nearly twenty years and know how to design and code clean, search engine-friendly websites.
  • Mobile Ready.  Our websites are fully responsive and mobile-friendly, ensuring that they will scale to size on all devices.
  • Built With WordPress.  Our websites are built with WordPress and run on a state-of-the-art hosting platform built especially for WordPress. Your website is fast, secure, and easy to edit.
  • Easily Scalable.  All of our websites are scalable. You can easily add sections and pages as your law practice, or law firm grows.
  • 24/7 Support.  Our websites are backed by 24/7 support and an army of WordPress engineers.
